comments.body: I do not see the impl that support fit/transform in Predictor/PredictionModel, it seems that in this PR all algs in ML do not impl this new fit/transform with more features cols?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +156,160 @@   * @return Whether this predictor support multiple columns for features
   */
  protected def isSupportMultiColumnsForFeatures: Boolean = false

  override def fit(dataset: Dataset[_]): M = {

comments.body: I place it in `PredictorParam` so that methods like `GBTModel.evaluateEachIteration` can reuse it in the future.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +65,69 @@
  /**
   * Extract [[labelCol]], weightCol(if any) and [[featuresCol]] from the given dataset,
   * and put it in an RDD with strong types.
   */

comments.body: Here too do you need a weight col, if the implementation doesn't support it (and shouldn't be calling this method)? or is it different?

It is different from the above place. Even if a ML impl supports weighting, its `weightCol` is not necessary to be set, in this case, `lit(1)` is used implictly. Current all algs supporting weighting deal with `weightCol` in this way.
